alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:08PM CST until January 29 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Walker and Trinity Counties. Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Polk, Liberty and San Jacinto Counties. Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Hardin and Polk Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 51.5 feet, Moderate lowland flooding continues with up to one foot of water is over the road at the intersection of Bellau Wodd and Riviera and many homes in the Northshore subdivision are cutoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 48.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 50.3 feet late tonight. It will then fall tomorrow morning. It will rise to 51.7 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 51.7 feet on 06/27/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 48.8 Wed 1 pm CST 50.7 51.7 51.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight.Thursday morning at 815 AM CST.
